problem_description: midazolam is to be dosed every 10 minutes under "Management of Adequate vs. Inadequate Airway" but every 5 minutes under "Sedation and Analgesia For Advanced Airway Placement"; intervals should be standardized or rationale explained.

problem_name: Nasal Cannula at 15 LPM During Intubation
problem_description: applying nasal cannula at 15 lpm during intubation attempts is not universally supported and may be unnecessary or inappropriate in all patients; recommend clarifying intent (e.g.
column4: apneic oxygenation) and referencing supporting literature or limiting to appropriate situations.

problem_description: sellick's maneuver (cricoid pressure) is no longer widely recommended due to insufficient evidence of benefit and possible harm; protocol should update or qualify this recommendation.
there is no mention of pediatric airway considerations or modifications
column4: which may lead to unsafe practice in children or infants.

problem_name: No Mention of End-Tidal CO2 Colorimetric Devices
problem_description: the protocol mandates "capnography" but does not specify what to do if waveform is unavailable; clarification may improve care in low-resource situations.
protocol instructs to "consult medical control where indicated" but does not provide criteria for when consultation is required.

problem_name: BVM Placement Before Airway Adjunct Missing
problem_description: bag-valve-mask should be emphasized prior to advanced airway if basic maneuvers are ineffective instead of in parallel with nasal/oral airway adjunct placement; current wording may lead to suboptimal sequence.
documentation of failed intubation attempts is mentioned but documentation standards for other procedures (e.g. capnography
column4: extraglottic devices) are not as clear; consider consolidating or referencing documentation protocols.

problem_name: Selective Airway Device Use Not Standardized
column4: only paramedics are instructed to "consider" an extraglottic airway if unable to intubate
column6: the instruction seems more general; clarity may help teams function more cohesively.

problem_name: No Explicit Confirmation Steps For ETT
problem_description: protocol lacks a step-by-step sequence for confirming tube placement by multiple methods after intubation attempt
column4: which may result in unrecognized misplaced airway.

problem_name: No Mention of BLS Airway Escalation
problem_description: protocol does not specify when to escalate from BLS maneuvers to advanced airway for basic providers
basic manuvers first should be "basic maneuvers first".
some sections (particularly medication options) use complex nested bulleted/numbered lists that could be clearer
column4: for example in sedation and analgesia the combination/sequence of drugs is not immediately apparent.

problem_description: AEMT: apneic or pulseless and apneic patient only is awkwardly constructed and could confuse readers; clarify whether both apneic-only and pulseless/apneic patients are meant.
consider c-collar to maintain ETT placement uses ETT (endotracheal tube) without introducing or defining the abbreviation earlier in the document.

column6: "APPROPRIATE") are in all-caps without clear distinction or consistent use
column7: which can make scanning the protocol difficult.

problem_description: BIAD is defined in "Other Information" but not at first use; EMT
column5: and RSI are not explained in this document
column6: which may interfere with comprehension for new or cross-trained staff.

problem_description: the phrase "treat per specific protocol" is used but does not reference a protocol name
column6: which may cause delays or confusion.
